brief_summary.textblock:
We randomize individuals with impaired glucose tolerance to one of three arms for degree of
      physical activity: 1. Continue with your current life style; 2. Ordinary life activities for
      increased physical activity; 3. Scheduled group activities for changed behavior. The overall
      aim is to focus on change of physical activity and to keep other life style activities more
      or less unchanged (diet, smoking, etc) and the effect on metabolic variables.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Impaired glucose tolerance

          2. Age: 20-85yrs

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Type2 diabetes

          2. Significant disease making life style changes unlikely to happen

          3. Unable to communicate in Swedish

intervention.description: We administer, a pedometer and the participants receive a prescription on physical exercise.
We schedule group sessions for changes in behavior e.g. type of physical activity to prefer, barriers for change of life style etc.

clinical_study.official_title: Diabetes Prevention in Primary Health Care With Special Emphasis on Physical Activity.

oversight_info.authority: Sweden: The National Board of Health and Welfare

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
